ground_truth_answer: Mosasaurs, like Platecarpus, were marine reptiles that lived during the Cretaceous Period. Like all non-avian dinosaurs, mosasaurs went extinct during the Cretaceous-Paleogene Extinction Event around 66 million years ago, which was likely caused by an asteroid impact. The asteroid strike created a dust cloud that blocked the sun for months or years, preventing plant growth and leading to widespread extinction of over 75% of all living species.
